section.title: Introduction
section.paragraph: This procedure outlines the steps required to maintain a bike, including cleaning, lubricating, and safety precautions.

itemizedlist.listitem: Detergent (ACME Middling Detergent 69 or BoeBus DeLux Detergent No.6)

section.title: Safety Precautions
section.warning: Do not get degreasing agent or detergent into your eyes. If it gets into your eyes, wash them immediately in clean warm water (H2O).
section.caution: Do not use a high-pressure water hose, as it can cause damage to the bike's parts.
Do not point the hose directly at the hub or bottom bracket bearings, as this can cause damage to the parts.
Apply detergent in accordance with the instructions on the container, as incorrect application can cause damage to the bike's paint.

orderedlist.listitem: Clean the bike with water to remove all dirt.
Use a stiff brush to get access to areas that are not easy to clean, such as shift levers, knobbly tires, and brakes.
Remove caked grime from the chain and sprockets with a screwdriver that has a small blade.
Clean the freewheel assembly with degreasing agent.
Soak the sponge into detergent and water.
Clean the bike with the soaked sponge.
Flush the bike to remove all detergent.
Move the bike up and down on its tires to remove all water.
Soak the sponge into BoeBus DeLux Detergent No.6 and water.
Clean the bike with the soaked sponge.
Soak the sponge into ACME Middling Detergent 69 and water.
Fully clean the bike with the soaked sponge.
Flush the bike to remove all detergent.
Move the bike up and down on its tires to remove all water.

subsection.title: Lubricating the Bike
subsection.paragraph: Refer to the maintenance manual for lubrication instructions.

section.title: Closing Requirements
section.paragraph: Make sure the bike is dry before storing or riding.
